body.p:
London
March 18th 1864
Gov T E Bramlette

Dear Sir an Indictment has at this Term of Laurel Circuit Court been returned against Aron Hash Jesse Johnson and John Storm for the Murder of James West and William Chitwood in this county I heard the evidence before the court of enquiry and can safely say that it is one of the most aggravated cases of Murder and Robery that I ever heard the evidence in Hash and Storm were the only ones on trial before the court of enquiry Johnson had not then been arrested he belonged to the 14th Ky Cavalry we have news this evening from the commander of the post at Camp Nelson ^that he is arrested & is^ awaiting for the civil authority to send for
him the sheriff of this county will start on tomorrow Hash and Storm put off their trial our Jail being destroyed by the Army we had to place them under Guard and the night after the trial was continued Hash made his escape and is now at large please offer as liberal reward as you can for the aprehension of said Hash

Granville Pearl
Judge 12th Dst of Ky

P S Aron Hash is about twenty three years of age six feet high slender made will weigh about 140lb sollow complexion dark eyes rather dark hair smooth face no beard has a reckless and apparently uneasy appearance and countenance rather badly dressed
Gov Bramlette I investigated the case of Hash and others before the grand jury and fully concur in the statements made by Judge Pearl and hope you will offer a reward
Offer a reward of $200 each for Hash & Storm
